result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant James E Krutke in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss read in this case. So ordered.

Defendant James E Krutke in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Guza informs def will not proceed forwa4rd until 14CF346 is resolved.

Defendant James E Krutke in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has read bail motion and denies without statements from counsel.
Atty Guza files w/motion to modify
Def's m/modify bond.  Scanned & forwarded to B2 for review, counsel indicating motion set for 4/1 at 1:15 pm which is not on the calendar.
Further proceedings on April 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
State's notice, demand, and motion for discovery and inspection

Defendant James E Krutke in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey Alan Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing will be waived. Will recall. Case recalled, appearances same.   Preliminary hearing waived.  Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. Information filed.  Information read, defendant advised of penalties, further reading waived. Plea of not guilty entered.
Status conference on March 5, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant James E Krutke in court with attorney Jeremy Guza.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request to possible global resolution. Time limits continue to waive and set for status for March 5, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on January 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

(OFF RECORD) Defendant James E Krutke in court with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Case not called on the record due to illness of the court, matter rescheduled by clerk and parties.  Defendant has additional cases, may be possible global resolution.  Status conference scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for James E Krutke Jr.
Current: 316 Fredonia Ave, Fredonia, WI 53021 United States  (Effective: 12-19-2014)
Prior: 409 Mckinley Ave, Hartford, WI 53027

Total of $2500 on both cases 14CF346/347 w/condition: No contact with C.P. or S.W., absolute sobriety, no controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.

Branch 1 presiding for Branch 2 for bail hearing only. Defendant James E Krutke in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of complaint/penalties thereof of cases 14CF346 & 14CF347. Court is informed defendant is eligible for the public defender, will appoint counsel as he has a conflict. Defendant has a pending case in Branch 2. Atty. DeJunco reserves argument on bail. State recommendation of $2500 cash on each file. Court is informed there is a hold on defendant. Court sets bail at $2500 total w/conditions. Court finds good cause for not scheduling preliminary hearing.  Status hearing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
